availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Hillary G. Jackson (Bullitt County, Kentucky, laborer & private 26th KY Inf USA)

body.p: Bullitt County, Kentucky, laborer and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of John Jackson and Catherine Jackson. Laborer in Bullitt County in 1860. Served in the 26th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private from October 8, 1864, to July 10, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bullitt County, p. 203A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bullitt County, District No. 3, p. 797.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 716.
